audio_item.dc.title: Sound Recording - University of Michigan Men's Glee Club & Duke University Glee Club Combined Concert - 1961 November 04
audio_item.dc.contributor.author: University of Michigan. Men's Glee Club
audio_item.dc.rights.access: This material is available for research only in the Reading Room of the Bentley Historical Library at the University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI).
audio_item.dc.rights.copyright: This recording may be protected by copyright law. Every audio, visual, or textual work has copyright protection unless that protection has expired over time or its creator has placed it in the public domain. audio_item.dc.description: Content note: The sound recording(s) associated with this repository item derive from a single audio reel tape. A single tape may yield multiple audio files if there were variations in tape stock, speed, or channels (i.e. stereo or mono). For more information see http://deepblue.lib.umich.edu/handle/2027.42/108126.
audio_item.dc.abstract: [Program 20] : [Side 1] : [Part 1] : Tape 2 of 2; Duke University's Glee Club performs Sacred Concert; Cantate Domino; When His Loud Voice In Thunder Spoke; Tarantella; The Ballad of Little Musgrave and Lady Barnard; Casey Jones; Black Is The Color of My True Love's Hair; Poor Man Lazarus; and a selection of Michigan songs: Laudes Atque Carmina; Come, Let's Be Merry; Echo Song; The Heart Worships; Money, O!; Ain' Got Time To Die; (Friars) Selections; Speak To Me of Love; What Is This Thing Called Love?; Love Is The Sweetest Thing; Love Is a Many Splendored Thing; Love Is A Simple Thing; Would You Like To Take a Walk?; Strange Music; I Met A Girl; Soft Lights and Sweet Music; 'S Wonderful, 'S Marvelous; Our Love Is Here To Stay; Love Is Sweeping The Country; Michigan Songs; (The Alma Maters) Dear Ole Duke; The Yellow and Blue.
